cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 345 mi SSE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn northwest, then north-northwest across the southeastern Gulf of Mexico toward the west-central Florida coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast near the Tampa Bay area

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of the Florida peninsula from the Keys northward through the Big Bend, including Tampa Bay and adjacent barrier islands
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are likely (34-63 kt) with a 65% chance; sustained hurricane-force winds cannot be ruled out if Ian tracks directly toward Tampa Bay.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for moderate to major storm surge in and around Tampa Bay if the system makes landfall just north of the port; exact values to be provided in later advisories.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4â€“6 inches of rainfall with locally higher amounts could produce flash and urban flooding in the Tampa Bay / Port Manatee area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; dangerous rip currents and heavy surf ahead of landfall.
